intro: Atenia kelloggii, commonly known as Kellogg's atenia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Atenia kelloggii is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
